channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Ancient ‘Dial-a-Poem’ Service Rises From the Grave, Lets You Use Your Phone as a Phone
item.description: There's something rather poetic about a service designed to breathe life back into poetry getting resurrected after all these years.

item.title: 'Companies that are not set up to quickly adopt AI workers will be at a huge disadvantage': OpenAI Sam Altman warns firms not to fall behind on AI - but notes 'it’s going to take a lot of work and some risk'
item.description: OpenAI CEO unsurprisingly positive about AI adoption - except if these headwinds spring up.

item.title: ChatGPT is having some issues, as OpenAI confirms an active issue — here's everything we know
item.description: Just a day after issues, ChatGPT is again experiencing a disruption with OpenAI confirming an active issue.

item.title: Microsoft's next-gen Xbox console may land in 2027, according to AMD – but the console wars are over
item.description: As gamers prepare for Valve's Steam Machine, AMD has just hinted at Microsoft's next-gen Xbox console coming in 2027.

item.title: Last call, folks — today is the final day you can get an unlimited data plan for just $10/mo at this popular carrier
item.description: Mint Mobile's incredible coupon code for discounted three-month plans ends tonight, so be quick if you're interested in seriously cheap unlimited plans.

item.description: MSI’s Claw handheld gaming console is powered by a Core Ultra 7 CPU with 1TB SSD and 16GB RAM, and priced under £300.

item.title: La Banque Postale fait aussi un geste contre Visa et Mastercard
item.description: La Banque Postale va basculer sur le réseau français CB pour les paiements sans contact réalisés avec Samsung Pay. Un petit geste qui permet de réduire la dépendance à Visa et Mastercard.

item.title: I was detained by federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: In late 2025, the Department of Homeland Security zeroed in on the Twin Cities in Minnesota, supposedly in response to fraud allegations made by a right-wing influencer. In the months since, thousands of immigrants have been swept up by Immigrations and Customs Enforcement. In January alone, two American citizens were killed while documenting ICE operations […]...

item.title: Apple TV details its 2026 streaming lineup with big list of announcements
item.description: For much of its existence, Apple's streaming service has seemed intent to focus on quality over quantity, offering some great shows but often feeling barren in comparison to competitors like Netflix and Disney. But as Apple TV looks to expand its reach to hit a larger audience, it appears the "quantity" part of that equation […]

item.title: Google Cloud’s customer chief returns to Microsoft as head of security
item.description: Microsoft has a new head of security. Hayete Gallot, who left Microsoft in October 2024 to become the president of Google Cloud's customer experience, is returning to the software giant as the executive vice president of security, reporting directly to CEO Satya Nadella. The move means Charlie Bell, formerly Microsoft's security chief, is taking on […]...

A teaser shared on Wednesday shows off the new device in a powdery blue color, which will be available for preorder on February 18th. Based on the teaser shared by Google, the Pixel 10A looks a lot like […]

item.title: Ce neutrino 100 000 fois plus puissant que le LHC met les physiciens sur la piste d’un trou noir primordial !
item.description: En février 2023, un neutrino d’une énergie folle a été détecté dans les profondeurs de la Méditerranée. D’une énergie même qu’aucun neutrino ne devrait atteindre. Sauf si…

item.title: La version 512 Go de ce récent smartphone OnePlus perd déjà plus de 100 € de son prix
item.description: Écran bien fluide, puce puissante, design plus sobre que celui de son prédécesseur : le OnePlus Nord 5 est un smartphone solide sur ses appuis qui a encore de beaux jours devant lui. Actuellement, PC Componentes le propose à un excellent prix : 418 euros au lieu de 519 euros.

item.title: ‘Dropping this while there’s still a month left is torture’: Bridgerton fans are hot for new season 4 part 2 bathtub teaser — but they’re forgetting a huge issue
item.description: Bridgerton season 4 part 2 first teaser confirms the long-awaited bathtub scene from original books — but I’m still not over Benedict and Sophie’s biggest issue.

item.title: Anthropic says it won't bring ads to Claude, unlike rival ChatGPT
item.description: Anthropic has announced that its chatbot Claude will remain ad-free. This is in direct contrast to rival company OpenAI, which recently brought ads to ChatGPT for many users. The company says that "including ads in conversations with Claude would be incompatible" with the chatbot becoming a "genuinely helpful assistant for work and for deep thinking." The reasoning here is rather simple. People tend to share personal details with chatbots, for better or for worse, and getting ads based on that stuff would be creepy. Imagine asking for mental health advice and getting an ad for St. John's wort ...

item.title: Exclusive: Disney+ just added We Call It Imagineering — and more episodes are coming soon
item.description: We Call It Imagineering brings its behind-the-scenes look at Disney Imagineering to a bigger audience, with new episodes on Disney+.

item.title: The 11 best gifts under $25 for 2026
item.description: The most hyped tech is often also the most expensive: flagship smartphones, ultra-powerful gaming laptops, immersive VR headsets and the like. But it would be wrong to assume that those are the only pieces of technology worth gifting. You don’t have to drain your wallet to get someone a cool gadget that will both be useful and make their lives easier. There are more solid, affordable gadgets out there now more than ever, but that also means you’ll discover some junk along the way. We’ve collected our favorite pieces of tech under $25 that make great gifts and help you to stick to a budget. Bes...

item.title: A24 Will Revive ‘Texas Chainsaw Massacre’ With a TV Show and Movie
item.description: The future of 'Texas Chainsaw Massacre' belongs to television, Glen Powell, and an eventual movie.

item.title: Copilot peine toujours à convaincre face à Gemini et ChatGPT
item.description: Microsoft se rêve en champion de l'IA, en numéro 1 d'un secteur en plein bouillonnement… mais dans les faits, ses solutions Copilot sont parmi les moins populaires. Pire, les utilisateurs s'en détournent au profit de la concurrence.

item.title: GitHub adds Claude and Codex AI coding agents
item.description: GitHub is making Claude by Anthropic and OpenAI's Codex AI coding agents directly available inside GitHub today. A new public preview adds Claude and Codex to GitHub, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio Code, for users with a Copilot Pro Plus or Copilot Enterprise subscription. The move is part of Agent HQ, GitHub's vision to make […]

item.title: Roblox calls its take on AI world models ‘real-time dreaming’
item.description: Less than a week after Google showed off Project Genie, a tool powered by an AI world model that lets users generate interactive 3D experiences from prompts, Roblox is sharing some early ideas about how it wants to use AI world models and prompts to let creators generate experiences and change them in real time […]

item.title: Fallout’s season 2 finale left plenty unanswered as it expanded in scope
item.description: There's been a clear shift over Fallout's second season. While the show started out as a relatively goofy introduction to the postapocalyptic wasteland, one that nailed the vibes of the games perfectly, season 2 has been intent on making the world even bigger. And nowhere was that more clear than in the season finale, in […]

item.title: « Nous avons une preuve » : un scientifique de Harvard relance l’hypothèse extraterrestre
item.description: Sommes-nous seuls ? C’est probablement la question la plus profonde qui se pose aujourd’hui encore à l’humanité. Et si la réponse à cette question était non ? Serions-nous prêts à l’accepter ? Pour Avi Loeb, astrophysicien à l’université de Harvard (États-Unis), une technologie extraterrestre a...

item.title: This Earth-Facing Sunspot Region Is Absolutely Popping Off
item.description: A large, hyperactive group of sunspots just produced its sixth X-class solar flare of the week.

item.title: ‘Incognito’ operator sentenced to 30 years for running a dark web drug market
item.description: On Tuesday, Rui-Siang Lin was sentenced to 30 years in prison for running "Incognito Market," a dark web platform that prosecutors say "sold more than $105 million of narcotics-including more than 1,000 kilograms of cocaine, over 1,000 kilograms of methamphetamines, hundreds of kilograms of other narcotics, and more than 4 kilograms of purported 'oxycodone'," between […]...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Unpacked 2026: Everything we're expecting from the S26 launch
item.description: Samsung’s 2025 was filled with new foldables, an ultra-thin new form factor and the launch of Google's XR platform. After making some announcements at CES 2026, the company is expected to host its first Galaxy Unpacked of the year in February to introduce the Galaxy S26 lineup. Official invites have yet to be shared, but the date is widely expected to be near the end of the month, probably on February 25 But as usual, we know a lot about what’s expected when Samsung does hold its next event.Whenever it does happen, Engadget will be covering Galaxy Unpacked live, and we'll most likely have hand...

item.title: 'A bet for the future of cybersecurity' – Nord Security hits 400 patents as race for solutions against next-gen threats heats up
item.description: Nord Security has quadrupled its patent count since 2023, signaling a massive shift towards post-quantum encryption and AI-driven threat detection to future-proof its privacy tools.

item.title: EE was down for many –here's what happened during the latest outage
item.description: The EE network was down for many in the UK today, but the network seems to have fixed the issues with outgoing calls –here's what happened.

item.title: Pinterest Reportedly Fires Employees Who Built a Tool to Track Layoffs
item.description: Pinterest says the internal layoff-tracking tool built by company engineers violated company policy.

item.title: Trump administration to unveil grand plan for countering China’s control on critical minerals
item.description: The comprehensive plan will come two days after Trump revealed Project Vault, a $12 billion stockpile of rare earth minerals. President Donald Trump’s administration is expected to unveil its grandest plan yet to rebuild supply chains of critical minerals needed for everything from jet engines to smartphones, likely through purchase agreements with partners on top of creating a $12 billion U.S. strategic reserve to help counter China’s dominance.Vice President JD Vance is set to deliver a keynote address Wednesday at a meeting that Secretary of State Marco Rubio is hosting with officials from ...

item.title: 'A violation of fundamental rights' – Civil society calls on Switzerland to abandon data retention proposals
item.description: Switzerland wants to expand its surveillance law and require VPNs, messaging apps, social media platforms, and other online services to collect data to help identify their users.

item.title: iPhone Fold rumors: Everything we know so far, including the leaked foldable design
item.description: Apple’s long-rumored foldable iPhone hasn’t been announced yet, but after years of speculation, it seems like this device could finally be coming out soon(ish). Multiple sources claim that Apple could be targeting a late-2026 launch for its first foldable phone, and new rumors suggest the company is even already thinking about its second model, which could be a clamshell-style foldable iPhone.But of course, nothing is official yet. Plans can change, features can be dropped and timelines can slip. Still, recent reports paint the clearest picture yet of how Apple might approach a foldable iPhone...

item.title: Super deal du jour : -30% sur ce TV Mini LED Philips Ambilight de 65″ (144 Hz), taillé pour l’immersion
item.description: À la recherche d'un nouveau TV offrant une belle qualité d'image ? Le Philips 65PML9059/12 propose un écran Mini LED avec de l’Ambilight pour sublimer le tout, avec un prix plus avantageux qu’à son lancement : 699 euros contre 999 euros.

item.title: Presidents' Day sales 2026: The best tech deals from Apple, Sony, Roku and others
item.description: You can find a lot of good deals for Presidents’ Day, but to say it’s a tech-deal boon would be an overstatement. The best Presidents’ Day deals are usually on mattresses, appliances and furniture, but you can find some decent tech sales thrown in as well. This year, Presidents’ Day comes right after Valentine’s Day and Super Bowl 2026, which means there are even more chances to save as sales and discounts overlap. If you’re looking for a new streaming device, a fresh iPad or an upgraded vacuum so you can enter the spring-cleaning season properly, we have you covered. These are the best Presid...

item.title: Experts Stuck 2 Mummies in a CT Scanner. Here’s What They Saw
item.description: This is probably not how the ancient Egyptian priests thought their afterlife would go.

item.title: Egypt to block Roblox for all users
item.description: Egyptian regulators have banned Roblox, a popular children's video game, Bloomberg reports. The nation's Supreme Council for Media Regulation is coordinating with the National Telecommunications Regulatory Authority on the decision to ensure its enforcement. The state-owned outlet reported that Senator Walaa Hermas Radwandid had proposed regulation of the platform to “protect children’s moral and educational values." The senator outlined his concerns with the nature of the Roblox platform, including the ability to communicate directly with strangers as well as "potential psychological and beha...

item.description: La marque de liseuses Kobo vous intéresse ? On vous explique tout pour vous aider à bien choisir et à profiter d'une expérience de lecture au top.

item.title: Microsoft warns infostealer malware is 'rapidly expanding beyond traditional Windows-focused campaigns' and targeting Mac devices
item.description: Hackers are increasingly targeting macOS users with social engineering and infostealers, Microsoft warns.

item.title: Coinbase, le géant des cryptos, est victime d’une nouvelle fuite de données
item.description: Coinbase, le géant américain des cryptomonnaies, a reconnu une nouvelle fuite de données. L’un de ses sous‑traitants a abusé de ses accès à l’outil interne de support pour consulter les données d'une partie des clients. Cet incident survient moins d’un an après une violation analogue. Là encore, c'est un prestataire qui était à l'origine de la fuite....

item.title: Inside the ICE Forum Where Agents Complain About Their Jobs
item.description: “I'm all for removing illegals, but snatching dudes off lawn mowers in Cali and leaving the truck and equipment just sitting there? Definitely not working smarter,” writes one forum user.

item.title: AI can now fake the videos we trust most. How to tell the difference—and how newsrooms can respond
item.description: Real eyewitness footage contains the rough edges that come with real life. Those traits are now creeping into AI-generated video, too. The footage was real, verified, and delightful: a security camera clip of a coyote bouncing on a backyard trampoline in Los Angeles. Days after the video went viral, near-identical kangaroos, bears, and rabbits began circulating too, all generated by AI. Millions shared them, believing they’d captured another glimpse of animals behaving hilariously. ...

item.title: ICE quietly scrambled for vaccine support after losing access through the VA
item.description: Records reveal that the VA cut off medical support used for detainees, forcing ICE into an emergency procurement amid mounting concerns about disease outbreaks and overcrowded facilities. In procurement documents quietly published last month, Immigration and Customs revealed that the Veterans Affairs administration abruptly cut off its access to vaccines that the agency has historically provided to the people it detains. It was one of a series of medical support services that were suddenly halted, and comes amid long-standing and growing concerns about the health care provided at ICE facilitie...

item.title: Boîte de réception | Recharge optimisée, recel d’iPhone et web clandestin
item.description: Chaque mercredi, notre journaliste répond à vos questions en lien avec le numérique et les nouvelles technologies. Cette semaine, on se demande s’il faut débrancher son iPhone de temps en temps, on devine pourquoi les voleurs aiment le téléphone d’Apple, et on revisite le web caché.

item.title: Alexa+ is now available nationwide, with a free text-based version for non-Prime members to try
item.description: Amazon’s next-generation AI assistant is now available to everyone in the US for $20 per month, or for free if you’re a Prime member. Amazon has also introduced a try-before-you-buy free tier for non-Prime members, but it’s limited to text-based chat. Alexa+ has been in early access since last year, and Amazon says it’s listened to user insights ahead of rolling out the update nationwide today. If you’re a Prime member, you can start using the new assistant by saying "Alexa, upgrade to Alexa+" or by heading to Alexa.com and signing into your Amazon account. The Alexa website is also where you’...

item.title: Trail, cyclisme, Hyrox : cette montre de sport devient bien plus puissante grâce à cette mise à jour

item.title: The 14-inch, ARM-based Asus Vivobook is half off today
item.description: I’m typically reluctant to recommend budget-friendly laptops, particularly ones that run Windows, because they suck, more often than not. That’s beginning to change, thanks in part to last year’s introduction of the Snapdragon X-series processors that offer solid performance and good x86 and x64 app compatibility. If you’re in need of a compact 14-inch laptop […]...
